definition: going or staying

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
old variant of 留[liu2]
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve
old variant of 留[liu2]

sentences.english: The porter and I looked at each other and smiled.
sentences.chinese: 我不认去留馆的路，就像一个搬运工打听。

sentences.english: David Trezeguet will meet with Juventus directors today to discuss his future.
sentences.chinese: 特雷泽盖将于今天和尤文管理层讨论将来的去留问题。

sentences.english: He hovered between staying and leaving.
sentences.chinese: 在去留问题上，他犹豫不决了。

sentences.english: But it's the producer who decides what songs go in there and what not.
sentences.chinese: 但这是制作人来决定歌曲的去留。

sentences.english: Cloud sent the report to the director huang himself the future results of two shao-qing su.
sentences.chinese: 程云发向黄局长汇报了自己对两个苏少卿的去留结果。

sentences.english: Do people think we will be filled and let to make the selecting of freedom between the going or staying?
sentences.chinese: 人认为我们会被充许在去留之间作出自由的选吗？

sentences.english: Liu Jie, president of Okay Airways and tone of the future is still without any definite conclusion.
sentences.chinese: 而奥凯航空总裁刘捷音的去留现在还没有定论。

sentences.english: Accidentally, hope heaven emanates leisurely clouds scud across the artistic conception.
sentences.chinese: 去留无意，望天上云卷云舒的闲适意境。

sentences.english: This, obviously, is a different sort of issue.
sentences.chinese: 讨论去留无疑是一个不同类型的议题。

definition: what course to follow/what path to take
to remain in office/to hold on to one's job
pending a decision/hanging in the balance
to renew or extend a contract
to leave one's post
choice of person/candidate
the position of sth/whereabouts
to consider/to weigh (a matter)/to balance (pros and cons)
to negotiate/negotiation/talks/conference/CL:個|个[ge4]
(written) resignation
to come to a decision/to fix on (a date etc)/to determine/to finalize/to nail down (a deal etc)
"Red Poppies", novel by 阿來|阿来[A1 lai2]
lit. the dust has settled (idiom)/fig. to get sorted out/to be finalized
rumor/gossip/to spread rumors
undecided/indeterminate/still in doubt
to leave home/to go off/to run away
to discuss/to deliberate
